Declaration:
1)We Declare that this invoice shows the actual price of the goods described and that all particulars are true and correct.
2)In case Material does not confirm our Technical/Drawing/Art work specification all expenses for returning good will be on account of suppliers.
3)Test Certificate/ Test Report of Raw Material and workmanship should accompany all consignments in the absence of TC/TR inspection charges as deemed suitable by us shall be recovered from the bill.
4)In case vendor fails to deliver the material on due date, the order can be cancelled without prior information to vendor and BTPL will not be liable to pay any compensation against the same.
5)Penalty charges of 5 % of the invoice value will be recovered against delay delivery & rejection due to quality / problem as mutually agreed.
6)Any environmental obligations, as per State Pollution Control Board related to this purchase order is sole responsibility of supplier.
7)Development cost should be recovered once minimum Qty will complete of each item.
For Bindal Technopolymer Pvt Ltd
Authorised Signatory
General Terms and Conditions :
1: Please Mention PO No., Item Code & HSN/SAC on all invoices.
2: Raw material used in Manufacturing of Item must be mentioned and certified.
3: Goods Should contain packing slip with description of Item, Item No.,Item Name and Quantity.
4: Buyers reserves the right to cancel, amend this PO or any percentage thereof.
5: Buyers assumes no obligation in relation to any Goods delivered in excess of those ordered.
6: GST amount will be paid only if our GSTIN details are mentioned in Tax invoice issued, liability of GST paid & GST return file intimation against this Purchase Order.
7: In case any credit, refund or other benefits denied or delayed to the Buyer due to any non-compliance by the Seller (Such as failure to upload the details of supply GSTIN portal, failure to pay GST to the Government) or due to non-furnishing or furnishing of incorrect or incomplete documents/details/information by the Seller, the Seller would reimburse the Buyers the loss to Buyer including, but not limited.
8: All Bills will be accepted as per rates and terms mentioned in this PO only.
9: Any Quantity over and above order quantity would not be accepted.
Legal Protection

b) If the Order is issued or arises pursuant to an agreement executed in writing between Purchaser and Seller (the "Agreement') in respect of Goods or Services. The terms of that Agreement shall govern in the event of any inconsistency.
c) This purchase order is an after by the company identified on the face of this purchase order the Buyer/Purchaser") for the purchase of the goods (the "Goods*) or services (the Services) specified from the party to whom the purchase order is addressed (the "Seller or "Vendor in accordance with and subject to these terms and conditions (the Terms and Conditions with the terms and conditions on the face of the purchase order. the "Order/"Purchase Order" This Order will be deemed accepted by the Seller/Vender upon the first of the following to occur:(a) Seller making Signing or delivering to Buyer/Purchaser any letter, form, or other writing or instrument acknowledging acceptance; (b)any performance by Seller Purchaser under the Order/Purchase Order, or c)the passage of ten (10) days after Sellers receipt of the Order/Purchase Order without written notice to Buyer/Purchaser that Seller does not accept. This Order. Together with any documents incorporated herein by reference, constitutes the sole and entire agreement of the parties with respect to the Order. The Order Purchase Order expressly limits Seller's acceptance to the terms of the Order. These Terms expressly exclude any of Seller's terms and conditions of sale and any other document issued by Seller in connection with this Order Purchaser Order.
2. General
a) Definitions: "Goods" means the products, equipment. articles or other materials to be supplied by Seller as more particularly described in the Order. "Services" means the services to be performed by Seller as more particularly described in the Order.
b) Governing Law: The Order shall be construed and governed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of India Shall in respect of matters made subject to arbitration herein or as per the terms of the Agreement, if any, the parties attorn to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts in New Delhi in connection with any disputes.
c) Severability: The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of the Order shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provision hereafter.
d) Waiver, Failure by either party to enforce any of its rights under the Order in a particular instance shall neither constitute a waiver of its rights under the Order or under any Agreement, if any. Nor shall it constitute a continuing waiver or preclude subsequent enforcement thereof. Delivery by Facsimile or Email: The execution of the Order may be communicated by facsimile transmission or email or by way of a ERPNEXT generated form or through a secured web. Portal in non-editable format and documents executed and delivered by electronic means shall be deemed to be an original document.
1) Entire Agreement: The Agreement (if any), the Order, and the Terms and Conditions are the entire agreement between the parties, and there are no verbal, express, or implied promises. representations agreements. or terms between Seller and Purchaser for the purchase of Seller's Goods or Services, other than as set out therein.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing. none of Seller's terms and conditions shall apply and Purchaser's acceptance of Seller's Goods or Services shall not be deemed an acceptance of any of Seller's terms. Amendments to the Order (and Agreement, if any) will be made in writing and by mutual agreement only, and must be signed by the parties or their duly authorized representatives.
2) Conflict: Subject to paragraph 1(b)above.in the event there is a conflict between the provisions of a Purchase Order (excluding the Terms and Conditions) and the Terms and Conditions. The increases in the purchase price stated in the Order will not be allowed...
3) General: If there is an error in any invoice the unit price set cut in the Order will be used as a basis for correcting the invoice. if the terms of the Order do not appear on or agree with Seller's invoice as rendered, Seller agrees that Purchaser may change Seller's invoice to conform to the Order and may make payments accordingly. Payment under the Order will be subject to deductions of any valid claim of Purchaser against Seller arising from this or any other transaction and all payments under the Order shall be subject to tax to be deducted al source as per the Income Tax Act, 1961 other withholding taxes.
4) Delivery and Delay:
a) Seller will deliver the Goods and complete the Services within the times specified in the Order.
b) Any Goods provided by Seller to Purchaser shall be af the sole risk of Seller until the time of delivery to Purchaser.

6) General Warranties: Supplier warrants that the Product will be in full accordance with the samples, drawings, specifications, markings and other written instructions given or agreed to by the Purchaser and will be of merchantable quality. produced with good materials, design and workmanship. free from all defects, and suitable for any purpose held out by 5upplier or made known lo Supplier by the Purchaser.
7) Quality and Design of Product: Goods furnished hereunder. Shall be of new malarial and Sellers or manufacturer's latest design and current model and
8) Seller warrants all Goods to be tree from defects in materials, design and workmanship. No used or second hand material, equipment or component whatsoever shall be tarnished or incorporated into any Goods furnished hereunder, unless otherwise specified in writing by Purchaser.
9) Right of Inspection: All Goods and Services covered by this transaction shall be subject to inspection at all times and places, bath as to progress and material and workmanship, and (in respect of Goods) shall be subject to final inspection and acceptance, prior to shiprnent.by an authorized representative to Purchaser.in the event inspection prior to shipment of Goods is waived on any or all such Goods,then such Goods shall be subject to inspection and acceptance by Purchaser at final destination, Lift all or any part of the Goods are found to be non-conforming. Purchaser may reject all or any part of the Goods. Rejected Goods shall promptly be removed by Seller at Seller's cost and the purchase price with respect to such rejected Goods(i)shall be refunded to Purchaser if already paid; or (i) shall be reduced as required if unpaid.
10) Patents, Trademarks, copyrights, Intellectual Property: Seller shall hold and save Purchaser its officers agents, servants and employees harmless from liability of any nature or kind for or on the account of the use of any patented or unpatented invention, trademarks, copyrights, intellectual properties, article, device or appliance furnished or used in the performance of Seller's obligations in respect of the Order including, without limitation, their use by Purchaser.
11) Changes and or Extras: Except as herein provided.no changes as to quantities, description, prices, F.O.B points, or otherwise, shall be made nor will any charge for extras be allowed unless the same have been authorized in writing by Purchaser and the proper price adjustment stated in such written change order, No charge will be allowed for freight, express, cartage, cases, Levy octroi or other transportation unless agreed to and specified in the Order.
12) Performance and Default: Time is of the essence of this transaction and therefore it is understood and agreed that for failure to supply the Goods or perform the Services with promptness and diligence or for failure to make shipment within the time specified, or any extension thereof. Seller shall be declared to be in defraud.
13) Remedy for Delays and Defaults: if Seller is declared to be in default, Purchaser may, by written notice, terminate the entire Order, or terminate Seller’s right to proceed with deliveries of such parts thereof as to which there has been delay..
14) Compliance with Law: Seller shall comply with all applicable Central, State, Municipal, Provincial and Laws and Regulations including specifically all statutory requirements as to production and labor standards
15) Termination: Any Order, a) With respect to Goods may be terminated or cancelled by Purchaser upon written notice to Seller ponor to completion and/or acceptance, in which event fair compensation will be agreed upon by Seller and Purchaser or, if agreement cannot be reached by the parties in respect of fair compensation, it shall be determined by arbitration; b) With respect to Services may be terminated or cancelled by Purchaser upon thirty (30)days' written notice to Seller.
16) Assignment by Seller: Seller shall not assign the Order without Purchaser's prior written consent which may be refused in the absolute discretion of Purchaser. Any attempted assignment without Purchaser's consent shall render the Order null and void.
17) Purchaser's Confidential Information: Seller agrees to keep in confidence all information of Purchaser that may be disclosed to it or that may be developed in connection with the Order and to require a similar obligation on the part df any subcontractors and agents of Seller to whom any work or duty in relation to the Order may be allotted, with the written permission of Purchaser and this confidentiality term shall remain in force tor a period of 2 years from the execution of the Order.
18) Arbitration Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Order, or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof toll amicably settled within thirty(30)days to the first written notice thereof being sent to one party by the other party, shall be referred to arbitration by a Sole arbitrator to be appointed by Purchaser. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the Indian Arbitration and Conciliation Act,1996,as amended, and rules tramped there under Arbitration shall be held in New Delhi. India and the language of Arbitration shall be English The costs of the arbitration shall be borne by the parties equally. This Agreement shall be governed in all respects by and construed in accordance within the laws of the Republic of India and the jurisdiction will be that of the Courts in Delhi. India Pending the submission to arbitration and thereafter, till the sole arbitrator renders his award or decision, the Parties shall, except in the event of any interim orderiaward is granted under the aforementioned Act. continue to perform their obligations under this Order.
19) Indemnification: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Purchaser and Seller further agree that the Seller shall indemnity, defend, and hold Purchaser, its employees, agents, subcontractors. officers, directors and shareholders (the Purchaser's Parties")harmless from and against any and all labilities, any special, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages of any kind including but no limed to, loss of profits or damages claims, demands. causes of actions, suits, and associated expenses (including all legal expenses and fees on a solicitor) or damages to business reputation however caused and on any theory of liability, whether in an action for contract, strict liabity or tort (including negligence)or otherwise whether or not the purchaser has been advised of the possibility of such damage and notwithstanding the failure df essential purpose of any remedy in connection with Seller’s supply of Goods and/or performance of Services under the Order, Seller hereby releases Purchaser and Purchaser's Parties from all liability in anyway occurring incident to, arising out of (direct, indirect or consequeritial ) or in connection with the performance or non-performance of the Seller under the terms of this Order.
20) The product/Service must be Manufactured/Supplied in Energy & EHS Friendly manner.
